text: Note that Poetry and Pyenv work well together. You just need to do a `pyenv local` in your package's folder before creating your virtualenv with Poetry, and it will use the right Python version when creating it. Poetry also works fine with non-PyPi package registries, although you need to manually modify the `pyproject.toml` file to make that work.

text: Pipenv is fine, but its dependency resolution algorithm sucks (Poetry's far faster, and manages to resolves in situations where Pipenv hangs). Also, Pipenv only does package and virtualenv management. Poetry adds package generation and build management on top of that, up to and including publishing packages.
